content:
C. blind man D. centurion’s 
servant. 
33. When they saw the man who had been possessed by 
demons in his right mind, the Gerasenes 
A. fled the city for fear 
B. asked Jesus to depart from then 
C. asked Jesus, ‘what is your name?’ 
D. asked Jesus to stay on  with the. 
34. One of the objectives, according to Mark, for which 
Jesus appointed the twelve, was for them to 
A. love one another 
B. make disciples of al the nations of the earth 
C. cast out demons 
D. denounce the hypocrisy of the Pharisees and 
the Sadducess. 
35. ‘Get behind me, Satan! For you are not on the side of 
God, but of men.’ 
The reason for this sharp rebuke was that the addressee 
A. confessed that Jesus is the Christ. 
B. wanted to dissuade Jesus from dying on the 
cross  
C. desired to be the right hand of Christ 
D. wanted Jesus to worship him. 
36. From the Parable of the friend at midnight we learn that 
A. we should always make our requests even at 
midnight 
B. we cannot receive anything from God if we 
don’t ask 
C. an evil father will always give good gifts to 
his children 
D. the heavenly Father will always give the Holy 
Spirit to anybody. 
37. And he was in the wilderness forty days, tempted by 
Satan; and he was with the wild beasts; and the angels 
ministered to him. 
Jesus was led into the wilderness by 
A. the devil B. the Spirit C. demons D. angels. 
38. Which of the following instructions was given only to 
the seventy and not to the twelve when Jesus sent His 
disciples on missions? 
A. Wipe off the dust from their feet 
B. Salute no one on the road 
C. Take no bag 
D. go from house to house. 
39. ‘But new wine must be put into fresh wine-skins. 
What issues was raised to which this statement was a 
response?  
A. Eating B. Drinking C. Fasting D. Praying. 
40. ‘Then render to Ceasar the things that are Ceaser’s and 
to God the things that are God’s.’ 
The above quotation teaches 
A. rejection of civil authority 
B. obedience to civil authority 
C. indifference to civil authority 
D. disobedience to civil authority. 
41. Who requested for the body of Jesus after His death? 
A. Nicodemus the Pharisee 
B. Simon of Cyrene 
C. Symon the disciple 
D. Joseph of Arimathea. 
42. ‘Did not our hearts burn within us while he talked to us 
...?’ This expresses the regret of 
A. Peter’s audience at Pentecost 
B. the twelve after His arrest 
C. Cleopas and one other disciple 
D. Cornelius and his friends. 
43. Paul was accused of apparently being a preacher of 
foreign divinities in Athens because he preached Jesus 
and the 
A. cross B. law C. resurrection D. second coming. 
 
44. When Paul and Barnabas healed a cripple at Lystra, the 
people named them 
A. Zeus and Hermes 
B. Zeus and Apollo 
C. Jupiter and Mercury 
D. Zeus and Mars. 
45. Paul told the Atheniasn that they were very religious 
because  
A. some of their poets said that men are the 
offsprings of God. 
B. they deidcated an altar to the Unknown God. 
C. their Epicurean and Stoic philosophers always 
discussed religious issues. 
D. the city was full of idols and symbols of 
religious devotion. 
46. The elders at Jerusalem advised Paul on his arrival in 
the city to 
A. avoid the Jewish Christians 
B. purify himself along with men under vows 
C. join those in the temple for prayer and fasting 
D. preach the good news. 
47. ‘Do not be afraid, but speak and do not be silent; for I 
am with you, and no man shall attack you to harm you; 
for I have many people in this city.’ 
A. Corinth B. Ephesus C. Athens D. Troas. 
48. To the question of the Philippian Jailer, ‘Men, what 
must I do to be saved? Paul replied, 
A. confess your sins and give alms 
B. believe in the Lord Jesus 
C. release us and wash our wounds 
D. trust in God and pray always. 
49. “Let it be kown to you then that if this salvation of God 
has been sent to the Gentiles, they will listen.” 
This imples that 
A. the Gentiles will be more receptive to 
Christianity than the Jews 
B. the Jews have lost the opportunity of salvation 
forever. 
C. the Gentiles are very understanding 
D. Paul has completely lost hope in the Jews. 
 
50. During the voyage to Rome, some people thought that 
Paul was a god because 
A. he caused rain to fall 
B. an angel appeared to him
